_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The Buddha's instructions to the mendica: Enter the rainy season residence with friends or acquaintances around Vesālī
Commence the rainy season residence in the little village of Beluva
The Buddha's thoughts and actions during: Fell severely ill, struck by dreadful pains, close to death
Endured unperturbed, with mindfulness and situational awareness
Thought of forcefully suppressing the illness, stabilizing the life force, and living on
Suppressed the illness and stabilized the life force
The Buddha's teachings to Venerable Ānan: Live as your own island, your own refuge, with no other refuge
Let the teaching be your island and your refuge, with no other refuge
Meditate by observing an aspect of the body
Meditate observing an aspect of feelings
Meditate observing an aspect of mind
Meditate observing an aspect of principles
Those who live as their own island, their own refuge, with no other refuge, and with the teaching as their island and their refuge, shall be among the best of the best.
